ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: there was no TA

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Maureen is one of the most engaged and connected instructors I have encountered at FES. She is extremely supportive and understanding. As a clinic, many of the questions above don't really apply.
Building relationships with clients. Engaging in real consulting work.
The instructor was always very responsive. The class lectures were short.
The practicality of the projects. We were consultants for a business/organization. It was very real world.
The client interaction... the client makes the course
Hands on work. You learn to do the job !
The teamwork experience and the experience working with a client. Although at many times difficult, it greatly helps build your practical skills and perspectives.
-real practical skills taught-interaction with real world-group work, thinking, dynamics
All the projects were solving actual problems for actual clients.

I enjoyed working with students with joint FES/SOM backgrounds- the difference in approach to problems was enriching and informative. I enjoyed working for a client with particular expectations, and responding to those expectations. I enjoyed challenging assignment, the subjects of which I was not very familiar with. I learned a great deal about working in the business world, especially when compared to the government or policy world.
consulting experience with a client on an topic which is within my areas of interest

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I didn't learn enough about financial modeling.
thread tying together the lectures

I'm not sure the lectures were all that useful. The time could have been better spent meeting with teammates or individually with the instructor. Finding time for everyone to meet three times a week in addition to class was pretty hard.
None. However, the experience of everyone depends on your projet, your client, and your team. If all three are great, you will have a great experience.
Some of the lectures were more relevant to specific types of projects than others
Grading system - 50% of the grades comes from the instructors evaluation of your work in the team. It is not clear how this evaluation was done.

Rather than only having meetings once a week. Having scheduled times for us to actually get work done would be useful. So tailoring those meetings to be times for us to get together to act or delegate, not only discuss progress (or lack thereof).
Not much. Maybe more prepping of the client so the students can get started more quickly.

weekly meetings with the prof were not necessary and tended to drag on; once or twice a month would have been sufficient.the actual classes/guest speakers were not particularly helpful as they didn't always relate to our individual projects. more hands on classes (like trying out marketing or financial analysis)may have been more useful.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The professor is exceptionally available to students. I have rarely had a teacher be so proactive about meeting with students outside of class time. She was extremely involved in my project from start to finish. She was a huge help.
Maureen is always available and helpful.
Maureen was always prompt to respond to inquiries and gave good advice during the meetings.
Maureen was very helpful and provided valuable input during our meetings. She also turned around her feedbacks to our drafts really quickly.
Maureen led excellent coaching sessions
Maureen is very friendly and approachable. She would always ask the right questions and help find answers.
She was very available, we met once a week.
-Maureen was very available and accessible - always willing to help and very supportive
Above and beyond.
Maureen was great and always available to help and provide feedback. Her editing skills are amazing.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am a student in business and the environment, considering consulting or entrepreneurship. This course was an obvious must for me.
This is definitely an interdisciplinary course.
I want to be a consultant some day and this course is a fantastic starting point especially when I do not have a background in business.
This class takes concepts I've learned and applies them to a real project in the "real" world.
Dealing with real clients is a part of real life.
I am interested in environment and business so this is a perfect class. Also a great way to transition into working in the private sector.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I love clinic courses. The experience is great.
To gain some experience with the business side of environmental issues.
To gain experience working on a consulting project and working with renewable energy
I wanted to work in the intersection of business and the environment.
Same as above.
I had taken mostly science courses and wanted to do something very different to get practical skills and participate in a clinical project.
I wanted to gain experience working for a client in a business setting. I also wanted to be in the role of a consultant. And I wanted to try something new.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: The project itself wasn't quite as exciting as I hoped. I would have liked to learn more about the company's use of green technologies. The course overall was fantastic. I would actually consider taking it again.
Yes
Mostly. Student motivation was sometimes lacking.
Yes.
Yes
More than lived up to my expectations.
Yes, it definitely gave me "outside of the classroom" experience
Yes.
Yes.
Yes!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, but a lot of that depends on the project/group you get - I got lucky but I know some other people had a harder time.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes
Of course.

The project result was very different than I hoped for. Same with the possibility of continuing a relationship with the client. That said, I learned a lot about flexibility and changing your goals and expectations as needed. So, I think it ultimately was not what I expected but still very good.
Besides some challenges with the client, yes.

I think I got a great deal more than what I expected. There are very stark differences between working in a strictly business environment and working for an NGO or a policy-oriented organization. I also learned a great deal about myself as a professional and as a person.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: we got a lot of work done. I couldn't have done it on my own. Disadvantages: so much time spent in meetings. Group work is extremely time consuming.
the whole class is the work group - it's fantastic

I was very disappointed with my teammates. This is the only group project I have done at Yale where my teammates did not step up to the plate. Perhaps the fact that neither of them were FES students was a factor. It felt like their priorities were different.
I had a great group and we all had different strengths and worked really well together. It was a very good experience and we produced a better product than we would have individually.
Advantages - Great learning experience. Team mates keep each other motivated. Progress is great and the team was very productive.

The advantage is that you get the mental and creative input of everyone. Also everyone helps out with the work so it is less of a burden on one person.Disadvantage is when one person takes the lead, then sometime the rest of the members sit and wait to be told what to do, or alternatively feel that they are being bossed around.

advantages - teaches you strengths/weaknesses in group, more realistic work setting for the 'real world', learn to work with different personalities/skills, etc. really good to leverage different interests and skills.disadvantages - different work ethics, different ideas of success, leadership, opinions.
Dividing up work was extremely important. Scheduling very busy people is hard.

Working with different people always helps me learn more about myself, and helps me identify the areas I need to improve on to become a better professional. My team members were extremely professional, but they came from different academic backgrounds, which was extremely enriching.
Learning how to manage a project team was very useful.
I liked the team evaluations - that was a good idea. This class can really only be done in teams because of the amount of work.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you want experience with financial modeling, make sure to ask up front about that. Some projects do, some don't. Choose a client who has worked with the clinic before or is local. It was really great to get to meet the client, see their offices, and develop a relationship with them. Some other clients were not so available.
get as much as you can out of your client(s)
Pick good teammates.
Take it!
Make sure workplans are well done and followed as closely as possible. Plan to turn things in well before finals start if possible.
The work is great - definitely take it if you want to learn something new and want to be in consulting.

Make sure you establish effective communication with the client very early. If you need them to respond within 72 hours of an email or phone call, make sure you are both on the same page about that. Outside of school, some organizations work on very different timescales. For this project, it doesnt work if the client does not respond for 3 weeks.
very group based class, but real world practical skills. fun!
Choose the right project.
It helps to research the client company as you are choosing which company to work for.
Front load your projects

Choose a project you are really interested in - you will spend a lot of time on it. Don't worry as much about sector/company.A devoted/engaged client is also important but you cant always determine that before.
